page.title: 17Ingatestone - shopping.
page.content: Ingatestone is a low-to-middle order shopping centre. The shops are largely located along the High Street. There is a good variety of food shops including three butchers, two bakers and two greengrocers. There are three general food shops the largest of which may be classified as a small supermarket. There is no large supermarket - people of the area often do their main weekly food shopping elsewhere e.g. Chelmsford. For the size of the village there is a remarkable variety of non-food shops and many of these are of a specialised nature providing high quality (and high price) goods. Examples are antique shops, a saddlery, jewellers and china and glass shops. The existence of such shops again reflects the relatively affluent nature of the area.
